content:
Yes, guided tours of the Tokyo National Stadium are offered to visitors, providing a chance to learn more about the history of the stadium and its new features. 

Tours are conducted on a regular basis, and they typically include stops at key areas of the stadium, such as the locker rooms, athlete tunnels, and VIP rooms. Visitors can also get a close-up look at the stadium's state-of-the-art facilities, such as the retractable roof and the innovative sound system.

There are also special tours available that focus on specific areas of interest, such as the stadium's architecture or its role as a major sports venue in Japan. 

If you're interested in taking a guided tour of the Tokyo National Stadium, you can contact the stadium directly or check with local travel agencies for more information.
